citation.article-title: Classification of eight new species of ammonia-oxidizing bacteria: Nitrosomonas communis sp. nov., Nitrosomonas ureae sp. nov., Nitrosomonas aestuarii sp. nov., Nitrosomonas marina sp. nov., Nitrosomonas nitrosa sp. nov., Nitrosomonas eutropha sp. nov., Nitrosomonas oligotropha sp. nov. and Nitrosomonas halophila sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Nitrosomonas ureae sp. nov.
Nitrosomonas ureae (u're.ae. ML n. urea, urea; ML gen. n. ureae, of urea)
The description is based on eight isolates.
Cells 0.9-1.1 by 1.5-2.5 μm with rounded ends.
Urea can be used as ammonia source.
The G + C content of the DNA is 45.6-46.0 mol% (Tm).
Habitat: common in soils and fresh waters.
Type strain: Nm 10 - culture collection of the Institut fur Allgemeine Botanik der Universitat Hamburg, Mikrobiologische Abteilung, FRG.
